intro: Navicularia syriaca subsp. raeseri, commonly known as the Syrian navicular, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Polygonaceae. It is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, clustered flowers that are typically pink or purplish in color. The leaves are usually ovate to elliptic in shape and have a distinctive reddish or bronze hue when mature. This subspecies is native to the Mediterranean region and thrives in rocky or sandy soils. It is often found in dry, sunny habitats and is valued for its ornamental appeal in gardens.
